statement.tex: %text If $\ora{a}+\ora{b}+\ora{c}$ and $|\ora{a}|=3$, $|\ora{b}|=5$ and $|\ora{c}|=7$, show that the angle between $\ora{a}$ and $\ora{b}$ is $60^\circ$. %

step.context: %text If the angle between $\ora{a}$ and $\ora{b}$ is $\theta$, what is $|\ora{c}|$ in terms of $|\ora{a}|$, $|\ora{b}|$ and $\theta$? %
step.reason: \begin{align} \ora{a}+\ora{b}+\ora{c}=0\implies(\ora{a}+\ora{b})=(-\ora{c}) \end{align} \\ %text Taking dot product of each side with itself, % \begin{align} &(\ora{a}+\ora{b})\cdot(\ora{a}+\ora{b})=(-\ora{c})\cdot(-\ora{c}) \\ \implies &\ora{a}\cdot\ora{a}+2(\ora{a}\cdot\ora{b}) +\ora{b}\cdot\ora{b}=\ora{c}\cdot\ora{c} \\ \implies &|\ora{a}|^2+|\ora{b}|^2+2|\ora{a}||\ora{b}|\cos\theta =|\ora{c}|^2 \end{align} \\
